results.title: An Approach for developing mathematical concepts
results.creator_credit: Dennis Claringbold and Melbourne College of Advanced Education. Media Production Centre
results.brief_description: Ross McKeown conducts a maths lesson for Year 2 students from Boronia Heights Primary School using the following steps. 1. Introduce concepts using concrete materials. 2. Games to reinforce concept. 3. Further practice and revision of concept. 4. Evaluation and recording of progress. Uses the concept of place value to demonstrate these techniques.

results.title: An Apple a day
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada International Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
Made before eating disorders were recognised as serious diseases, this documentary focuses on a hospital dietitian, a dentist and women in a dieting club as they discuss the evils of overeating. It also highlights the importance of good nutrition and regular exercise in maintaining a slender figure.

results.title: An American time capsule
results.creator_credit: Charles Braverman, Braverman Productions and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Condenses 200 years of American history into three volatile minutes. The film is a chronological capsule of 1,300 visuals (paintings, still photographs, newspaper headlines, early newsreels, posters and political cartoons). No commentary - music “Beat that drum” by Sandy Nelson.

results.title: An Airplane trip: an instructional sound film
results.brief_description: An instructional film of a plane trip. Dorothy and her mother travel from Los Angeles to salt Lake City. Shows and explains the duties involved in maintaining and servicing such a trip through the mechanics, stewardesses, and pilots and also includes the panoramic views as seen through the eyes of the passengers.

results.title: An Age of revolutions: USA
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The History of United States foreign relations”.
The first in a series which traces the development of American foreign relations. Presents a history of the United States from before the American War of Independence to the compilation of the Monroe Doctrine in the early nineteenth century. Focuses on America’s first ambassador, Benjamin Franklin, and American relations with the European powers during the War of Independence, the French Revolution and the era of Napoleon, the War of 1812 and the formulation of the Monroe Doctrine.

results.title: An Age of Revolutions. Great Britain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Revolution, nationalism, liberty, war, and industrialisation, were the main themes in the history of Europe from 1789 to 1870. This looks at the effects of the two main revolutions in this time, on the whole of Europe. The French Revolution brought new ideas and politics, and the Industrial Revolution brought new wealth and motives, and an urban industrialised society

results.title: An Act of faith
results.creator_credit: Robin Whitworth, BBC-TV and John Read
results.brief_description: The story of the new Cathedral at Coventry. Beginning with the blitz that destroyed the medieval church, it moves through all the stages of rebuilding and visits the studios of the artists concerned. Features Graham Sutherland’s gigantic tapestry, Epstein’s St. Michael and the devil, some of the stained glass windows, and the figures engraved on the plate glass entrance.
